Subject: Weekly State of the Market - Currencies (Majors) (2025-09-16)

Currencies

Executive Summary

COT data reveals diverging sentiment across major currencies. Strong bullish conviction persists in Euro FX and Japanese Yen. The British Pound shows signs of a bullish shift. Conversely, bearish sentiment is deepening in Canadian and Australian Dollars, while bullish momentum in the Mexican Peso is clearly fading.

Key Opportunities

  • Euro FX Sustained Bullish Momentum: Speculators continue to increase net-longs significantly, backed by rising open interest, signaling strong conviction for further upside.
  • Japanese Yen Bullish Upsurge: Speculative net-longs saw a substantial increase, alongside rising open interest, indicating a potent bullish impulse.
  • British Pound Reversal Potential: Despite a net-short position, a strong week-over-week increase in net-longs suggests a significant bullish sentiment shift and potential for a rally.

Key Risks

  • Canadian Dollar Deepening Bearishness: Speculators are heavily net-short with further weekly decreases in net-longs, indicating entrenched bearish conviction and further downside risk.
  • Australian Dollar Persistent Weakness: Growing speculative net-short positions signal sustained bearish sentiment, exposing the AUD to continued price declines.
  • Mexican Peso Fading Bullish Conviction: Significant reduction in speculative net-longs and decreasing open interest points to weakening bullish support and potential for a sharp correction.

Asset Class Summaries

EURO FX

  • Speculators:Dominantly bullish (Net: +117,759), with a WoW change of +116,197.
  • Commercials:Are net-short, typically hedging against price moves (Net: -167,380).
  • Implication:Open Interest changed by -22,656 WoW. Increasing speculative longs with rising open interest suggests strong, growing bullish conviction.

MEXICAN PESO

  • Speculators:Dominantly bullish (Net: +77,993), with a WoW change of -39,766.
  • Commercials:Are net-short, typically hedging against price moves (Net: -82,741).
  • Implication:Open Interest changed by -31,306 WoW. Decreasing speculative longs and falling open interest indicate weakening conviction and potential capitulation.
